title: German Science Professor Transforms University Observatory into Giant Replica of R2-D2
text:
Fan of Star Wars and electrotechnology professor of the German Zweibrücken University of Applied Sciences, Hubert Zitt is known for adding a sci-fi spin to his lectures. But in September 2018, he took his love of the iconic franchise to the next level by transforming the Zweibrück Observatory of the Natural Science Association into a giant replica of R2-D2.

Luckily, the dome-shaped structure already has a form resembling Star Wars’ loveable droid. Zitt had the help of his father-in-law, Horst Helle, painter Klaus Ruffing, and several helpful students to give the observatory a transformational lick of paint. Photos of the impressive blue and white design have been shared by science fiction fans everywhere, and even Star Wars actor Mark Hamill tweeted about it. In jest he wrote, “R2-D2 Observatory Transformed Germans Into Giant Nerds.”

In fact, Zitt is so knowledgeable in the field of science fiction that during 2005, he lectured in numerous other universities as well as Europe’s biggest Science Fiction Convention, FedCon. In 2008, he wrote the preface of the book Star Trek in Germany, and in the same year, the professor also became a regular lecturer at the The University of the Incarnate Word in San Antonio, Texas teaching “The Physics of Star Trek.”
